Label: A rdfs:label
Comments: rdfs:comment

Label: plant phenological trait
Text definition: A quality of a 'portion of a plant' or a whole plant that provides phenologically relevant information about the 'portion of a plant' or the 'whole plant'.

Label: plant structure presence
Text definition: A plant phenological trait that is measured by the number of some plant structure that are part of a whole plant.
Comments: The number can be 0 or more.

Label: abscised plant structure presence
Text definition: A plant phenological trait that is measured by the number of some plant structure that a whole plant has abscised or that have been removed from a whole plant.
Comments: The number can be 0 or more.

Label: new shoot system presence
Text definition: A plant phenological trait that is measured by the number of new shoot systems new shoot system on a whole plant.
Comments: The number can be 0 or more.

Label: new above-ground shoot-borne shoot system presence
Text definition: A plant phenological trait that is measured by the number of new above-ground shoot-borne shoot systems new above-ground shoot-borne shoot system on a whole plant.
Comments: The number can be 0 or more.

Label: new shoot system emerging from ground presence
Plant structure: new shoot system emerging from ground
Text definition: A plant phenological trait that is measured by the number of new shoot systems emerging from ground new shoot system emerging from ground on a whole plant.
Comments: The number can be 0 or more.

Label: new shoot system emerging from ground in first growth cycle presence
Plant structure: new shoot system emerging from ground in first growth cycle
Text definition: A plant phenological trait that is measured by the number of new shoot systems emerging from ground in first growth cycle new shoot system emerging from ground in first growth cycle on a whole plant.
Comments: The number can be 0 or more.

Label: seedling presence
Text definition: A plant phenological trait that is measured by whether or not a whole plant is a seedling.
Comments: For consistency with other trait measurements, 'seedling presence' is also measured with a count, which must be a binary value: 0 if the plant is a seedling, 1 if it is not.

Label: new shoot system emerging from ground in later growth cycle presence
Plant structure: new shoot system emerging from ground in later growth cycle
Text definition: A plant phenological trait that is measured by the number of new shoot systems emerging from ground in later growth cycle new shoot system emerging from ground in later growth cycle on a whole plant.
Comments: The number can be 0 or more.

Comments: The number can be 0 or more.

Label: abscised leaf presence
Text definition: A plant phenological trait that is measured by the number of true leaves true leaf that a whole plant has abscised.
Comments: The number can be 0 or more.

Label: abscised fruit or seed presence
Text definition: A plant phenological trait that is measured by the number of a whole plant's ripe fruits ripe fruit that have been abscised or removed by an herbivore and/or the number of ripe fruits on a whole plant that have abscised at least one mature seed.
Comments: The number can be 0 or more.

Label: abscised cone or seed presence
Text definition: A plant phenological trait that is measured by the number of a whole plant's ripe seed cones ripe seed cone that have been abscised or removed by an herbivore and/or the number of ripe seed cones on a whole plant that have abscised at least one mature seed.
Comments: The number can be 0 or more and only includes the most recent cone crop.
